author: holiman
content: If the aleut genesis had been generated via puppet (like, I think, every single previous PoA testnet), then that would have been fixed by default

author: holiman
content: Puppeth is not _only_ for managing remote machines, it's also a good starting point to generate a new network. It's a bit bitrotted in terms of how to create non-geth configs, but that can easily be fixed (and all the more so if it's more generally used, so non-geth devs would file tickets about what's wrong)

author: holiman
content: It also makes it easier to set the sealers (which is a bit of a hassle, if you want more than one sealer in the genesis), and adding funds to some chosen accounts, e.g. to use a faucet

author: pipermerriam
content: I'm a very strong üëé on introducing a token based voting system for the gas limit

author: uri_bloxroute
content:
The gas limit is decided by the miners, and effectively by the pools. Every new block can be up to 0.1% larger/smaller than the previous.
In reality, each pool configures its "desired gas limit", and each of them pushed the gas limit in that direction whevern they mine a block, the result is the gas limit is "hovering" around the weighted average

author: t11s_
content: Alright then why can‚Äôt that be changed to enforce a specific limit in consensus
